question.questionText: Which three of the following statements about an asynchronous message-based communication in microservices are true? (Choose three.)

options.option: Microservices can use the AMQP or MQTT protocols for asynchronous message-based communication.
An advantage of asynchronous communication is that messages can be buffered using message queues.
In asynchronous communication, clients must be available to receive messages to avoid losing the messages.
Using an asynchronous communication mechanism such as AMQP requires the use of a message broker or other similar middleware integration technology.

question.questionText: Which three of the following are microservice architecture patterns? (Choose three.)
Which two of the following statements regarding the fault tolerance patterns are true? (Choose two.)

options.option: The circuit breaker pattern has three distinct states: open, half-open, and broken.
While in the half-open state, a circuit breaker periodically allows service calls to execute to check the health of the dependent service.
The bulkhead pattern allows you to allocate a dedicated thread pool or a semaphore for each dependent service call, limiting the number of concurrent calls to the service.
The bulkhead pattern is used as a layer of abstraction between a client and services.
